Description: Handmade terracotta figure fragment of animal torso, probably a bull. Made of orange-brown clay.
Curator's comments: Handmade figurine of bull, missing limbs and head. It resembles Cypro-Archaic types, though the fabric is darker than is usual for the Cypriot figurines found in Naukratis. 6th century BC Halicarnassus parallels similar in fabric and style, but of horses (Higgins 1970, nos 310-311) and similar in form and fabric from Datcha, Turkey (GR1859,1226.631-2). Parallels from Cyprus are dated between the late 7th and the early 5th century BC (Karageorghis, 1998, expecially nos J24-J25; British Museum GR1969,0401.122). Karageorghis, V. 1998, The Coroplastic Art of Ancient Cyprus. V. The Cypro-Archaic Period Small Female Figurines A. Handmade / Wheelmade Figurines. Nicosia
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DB.002) (Phase 1)
